definitions.text: used especially of what is legally or ethically right or proper or fitting; - A.Lincoln
fair to all parties as dictated by reason and conscience
examples: an equitable distribution of gifts among the children

definitions.text: free from favoritism or self-interest or bias or deception; conforming with established standards or rules

examples: it is simply a matter of time
hopes that last but a moment
he was doing precisely (or exactly) what she had told him to do
it was just as he said--the jewel was gone
the sun just now came out
I just can't take it anymore
he was just grand as Romeo

definitions.text: only a very short time before; ; ; ; ; - W.B.Yeats
examples: they could barely hear the speaker
had scarcely rung the bell when the door flew open
would have scarce arrived before she would have found some excuse to leave

definitions.text: exactly at this moment or the moment described
examples: we've just finished painting the walls, so don't touch them
